subject: Communication
title: Individualism vs. Collectivism
description: A short lesson to help you apply Individualism vs. Collectivism.

hook.text: 'What do you want to be when you grow up?' In the US, it's about you. In Japan, it's about what your family needs.

buildup.text: Individualist cultures (US, UK, Australia) prioritize personal goals.

discovery.text: This dimension shapes communication: individualists are direct and self-promoting; collectivists are indirect and.

twist.text: Neither is morally superior. Individualism drives innovation but loneliness.

climax.text: About 70% of the world's cultures are collectivist. Individualism, though dominant in media, is the global minority.

punchline.text: Some ask 'Who am I?' Others ask 'Who are we?'

quiz.question: What percentage of the world's cultures are collectivist?
